intro: Senecio purpureoviridis, commonly known as the purple-green groundsel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features slender, upright stems covered in fine, hairy foliage that exhibits a distinctive combination of purple and green hues. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers with white ray florets, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Senecio purpureoviridis is well-suited for rock gardens and dry landscapes due to its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements.
